org.ijsberg.iglu.server.http.filter
Class WebAppEntryPoint

java.lang.Object
  org.ijsberg.iglu.server.http.filter.WebAppEntryPoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.servlet.Filter, org.ijsberg.iglu.access.EntryPoint
public class WebAppEntryPoint
extends Object
implements javax.servlet.Filter, org.ijsberg.iglu.access.EntryPoint

This filter can be used as point of entry into a web application. This filter performs several tasks:

  • It binds a request as soon as a http-request enters the system.
  • In the process it may also resolve a related session, referenced by a session token (stored client-side).
  • It releases the request as soon as the http-request has been processed.
  • It may perform role based access control.
  • It provides exception handling.
    • Servlets and JSP-pages that are part of the web application will thus be provided with a registered request that can be retrieved throughout the course of the request by invoking application.getCurrentRequest().

    Specify a servlet init parameter 'realm_id=....' to indicate which realm is entered here.

    Make sure to filter on dynamic content only, to avoid unnecessary overhead of request administration. If an URL-pattern matches multiple filters, the request will pass these filters in a chain. Note that the first filter creates the request and determines which realm is entered.
